      29             : 
      30             : /**
      31             :  * About event dispatching:
      32             :  * When either EventDispatcher::Dispatch or
      33             :  * EventDispatcher::DispatchDOMEvent is called an event target chain is
      34             :  * created. EventDispatcher creates the chain by calling GetEventTargetParent 
      35             :  * on each event target and the creation continues until either the mCanHandle
      36             :  * member of the EventChainPreVisitor object is false or the mParentTarget
      37             :  * does not point to a new target. The event target chain is created in the
      38             :  * heap.
      39             :  *
      40             :  * If the event needs retargeting, mEventTargetAtParent must be set in
      41             :  * GetEventTargetParent.
      42             :  *
      43             :  * The capture, target and bubble phases of the event dispatch are handled
      44             :  * by iterating through the event target chain. Iteration happens twice,
      45             :  * first for the default event group and then for the system event group.
      46             :  * While dispatching the event for the system event group PostHandleEvent
      47             :  * is called right after calling event listener for the current event target.
      48             :  */
      49             : 
      50           0 : class EventChainVisitor

      58             :     , mEvent(aEvent)

      60             :     , mEventStatus(aEventStatus)

      97             :   uint16_t              mItemFlags;

     104             :    *       It is up to the Pre/PostHandleEvent implementation to decide how to
     105             :    *       use this.
     106             :    */
     107             :   nsCOMPtr<nsISupports> mItemData;

     146             :   /**
     147             :    * Member that must be set in GetEventTargetParent by event targets. If set to
     148             :    * false, indicates that this event target will not be handling the event and
     149             :    * construction of the event target chain is complete. The target that sets
     150             :    * mCanHandle to false is NOT included in the event target chain.

     152             :   bool                  mCanHandle;

     238             : /**
     239             :  * The generic class for event dispatching.
     240             :  * Must not be used outside Gecko!
     241             :  */
     242             : class EventDispatcher
     243             : {
     244             : public:
     245             :   /**
     246             :    * aTarget should QI to EventTarget.
     247             :    * If the target of aEvent is set before calling this method, the target of 
     248             :    * aEvent is used as the target (unless there is event
     249             :    * retargeting) and the originalTarget of the DOM Event.
     250             :    * aTarget is always used as the starting point for constructing the event
     251             :    * target chain, no matter what the value of aEvent->mTarget is.
     252             :    * In other words, aEvent->mTarget is only a property of the event and it has
     253             :    * nothing to do with the construction of the event target chain.
     254             :    * Neither aTarget nor aEvent is allowed to be nullptr.
     255             :    *
     256             :    * If aTargets is non-null, event target chain will be created, but
     257             :    * event won't be handled. In this case aEvent->mMessage should be
     258             :    * eVoidEvent.
     259             :    * @note Use this method when dispatching a WidgetEvent.
     260             :    */
     261             :   static nsresult Dispatch(nsISupports* aTarget,
     262             :                            nsPresContext* aPresContext,
     263             :                            WidgetEvent* aEvent,
     264             :                            nsIDOMEvent* aDOMEvent = nullptr,
     265             :                            nsEventStatus* aEventStatus = nullptr,
     266             :                            EventDispatchingCallback* aCallback = nullptr,
     267             :                            nsTArray<dom::EventTarget*>* aTargets = nullptr);
     268             : 
     269             :   /**
     270             :    * Dispatches an event.
     271             :    * If aDOMEvent is not nullptr, it is used for dispatching
     272             :    * (aEvent can then be nullptr) and (if aDOMEvent is not |trusted| already),
     273             :    * the |trusted| flag is set based on the UniversalXPConnect capability.
     274             :    * Otherwise this works like EventDispatcher::Dispatch.
     275             :    * @note Use this method when dispatching nsIDOMEvent.
     276             :    */
     277             :   static nsresult DispatchDOMEvent(nsISupports* aTarget,
     278             :                                    WidgetEvent* aEvent,
     279             :                                    nsIDOMEvent* aDOMEvent,
     280             :                                    nsPresContext* aPresContext,
     281             :                                    nsEventStatus* aEventStatus);
     282             : 
     283             :   /**
     284             :    * Creates a DOM Event.  Returns null if the event type is unsupported.
     285             :    */
     286             :   static already_AddRefed<dom::Event> CreateEvent(dom::EventTarget* aOwner,
     287             :                                                   nsPresContext* aPresContext,
     288             :                                                   WidgetEvent* aEvent,
     289             :                                                   const nsAString& aEventType);
     290             : 
     291             :   /**
     292             :    * Called at shutting down.
     293             :    */
     294             :   static void Shutdown();
     295             : };
     296             :
